lastMinuteOpportunities.title: NASA Internships and Fellowships (multiple centers)
lastMinuteOpportunities.description: NASA offers a wide variety of paid internships for undergraduates at centers across the country. Summer positions span fields like engineering, computer science, physical sciences, life sciences, and more​:contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}. Interns work full-time for ~10 weeks on research or mission-support projects under NASA mentors. Opportunities exist at NASA research centers (e.g. Langley, Marshall, JPL, etc.), with projects in aerospace, robotics, planetary science, astrophysics, Earth science, and other STEM areas. U.S. citizenship (and sometimes permanent residency) is required. **Application is via the NASA Internships & Fellowships portal and the summer 2025 deadline is May 16, 2025**​:contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}. Accepted students receive a stipend (typically around $7,300 for 10 weeks, varies by location and academic level) and may be eligible for housing or travel allowances. lastMinuteOpportunities.eligibility: U.S. Citizens (most positions); must be enrolled undergraduates (community college, college or university). Open to many STEM majors.
lastMinuteOpportunities.funding: Paid internship (weekly stipend, ~$7K–$8K total, with housing or travel assistance in many cases)​:contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

lastMinuteOpportunities.title: NASA Ames Space Life Sciences Training Program (SLSTP)
lastMinuteOpportunities.description: The Space Life Sciences Training Program (SLSTP) is a specialized summer research internship at NASA Ames focused on space biology and bioengineering. It provides undergraduates entering their junior or senior year (and early graduate students) an 8–10 week hands-on research experience in areas like astrobiology, bioinformatics, synthetic biology, space health, and life support systems. Participants work on research projects under NASA scientists, attend lectures and professional development workshops, and gain exposure to how biological and life sciences research is conducted in the space program. U.S. citizenship is typically required. **Application deadline is May 16, 2025**, via the NASA Internships portal​:contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}. Interns receive a stipend (approximately $7,300 for the summer) and housing assistance. This is a **paid** fellowship for students in fields such as biology, bioengineering, biochemistry, biomedical engineering, or related disciplines interested in space life sciences. **Tags:** summer, research, life sciences, space, NASA
lastMinuteOpportunities.eligibility: U.S. Citizens (required); rising juniors, seniors, or early graduate students in relevant majors.
lastMinuteOpportunities.funding: Paid fellowship (stipend ~$7,000 for summer; housing and travel support provided)​:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

lastMinuteOpportunities.title: Harvard–MIT Summer Institute for Biomedical Optics (SIBO)
